meanings.definition: To remove or gather by or as if by scraping
meanings.sent1: I scrape the mud off my shoes before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: She used a spoon to scrape the last bit of ice cream from the container.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tried to scrape the lid off the trash can to get to the leftovers.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded like gravel scraping against metal.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to scrape the weeds from the flower bed to make room for new plants.

meanings.definition: To injure or damage by or as if by scraping
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to scrape your knee on the rough pavement.
meanings.sent2: The cat accidentally scrape the furniture while sharpening its claws.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally scrape his finger while chopping vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The branches scrape against the window during the storm, causing a scary sound.
meanings.sent5: The old car's paint was so worn that a light touch could scrape it off.

meanings.sent1: The scrape of the chair against the floor echoed in the empty room.

meanings.sent4: The scrape of the branches against the window made the dog bark in alarm.
meanings.sent5: The scrape of the pencil against the paper filled the classroom during the test.
